description: Vicarious liability - employer liable for employee's negligence
facts: Delivery driver ran a red light while making deliveries
Driver was using the company vehicle during work hours
The other driver suffered injuries and property damage
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, vicarious_liability). defendant(c1, delivery_company). plaintiff(c1, victim). employee(c1, driver). within_scope_employment(c1, yes). duty_owed(c1, yes). duty_breached(c1, yes). breach_cause(c1, ran_red_light). actual_cause(c1, yes). proximate_cause(c1, yes). damages(c1, 25000). injury_type(c1, physical).
question: Is the delivery company liable for the driver's negligence?
rationale: Under respondeat superior, employers are vicariously liable for torts committed by employees acting within the scope of their employment. The driver was making deliveries in a company vehicle during work hours, establishing scope of employment.
